titleStmt.title: Gandaline, Amadis of Gaules Squire; to Sancho Panca, Don-Quixotes Squire.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Gandaline, Amadis of Gaules Squire; to Sancho Panca, Don-Quixotes Squire.

monogr.title: The history of the valorovs and vvittie knight-errant, Don-Qvixote of the Mancha. Translated out of the Spanish
monogr.author: Cervantes Saavedra, Miguel de

div.head: Gandaline, Amadis of Gaules Squire; to Sancho Panca, Don-Quixotes Squire.

lg.l: HAile famous man! whom fortune hath so blist
When first in Squirelike trade, it thee did place
As thou didst soft, and sweetly passe disgrace,
Er thou thereof the threatning danger wist.
The Shouell or Sickle little doe resist
The wandring exercise; for nowe's in grace,
Plaine Squire like dealing, which doth quite deface,
His pride, that would the Moore boare with his fist.
Thine Asse I Iointly enuie and thy name,
And eke thy Wallet I doe emulate;
An argument of thy great prouidence:
Haile once againe; who, cause so good a man,
Thy worthes, our Spanish Ouid does relate,
And louely chaunts them, with all reuerence.
